author: Special Correspondent
text:
Doctors at a private hospital here harvested the vital organs of 60-year-old man, who was declared brain dead after suffering severe brain injury in an accident, and sent them to various hospitals for transplant on Saturday.

R. Manoharan, an agriculturist who was also running a voluntary organisation in Nagapattinam, met with an accident on Thanjavur-Nagapattinam highway and was admitted to the Government Hospital in Thanjavur on Wednesday. Investigations revealed he had suffered severe brain stem injury and was declared brain dead on Friday.

Mr. Manoharan, who was the son of Nagai Rengasamy, a freedom fighter, had registered his name for donating his body after death. As per his wish, his son Dr. Prabhu, a casualty medical officer, at Mahatma Gandhi Memorial Government Hospital in the city and his daughters, approached the Cethar Hospitals to retrieve the organs.

The patient was shifted to the city hospital and his liver, kidneys, and eyes were harvested. The liver was used for a patient with end-stage liver disease requiring transplant at Cethar Hospital. The kidneys were sent to Meenakshi Hospital in Thanjavur and Kidney Care Centre, Madurai. Both the eyes were sent to AG Eye Hospital, Tiruchi.
title: Organs of farmer harvested
